contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox rugby league biography |name = Zebastian Lucky Luisi |fullname = |nickname = Lucky, Zeb, Zebba |image = Zeb Luisi & Nick Fozzard.JPG |image_size = 150px |caption =Luisi playing for Harlequins in 2006 |country = |position = {{rlp|FB|WG|CE}} |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|12|22|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]] |height = 6 ft 0 in (1.83 m) |weight = 14 st 4 lb (91 Kg) |club1 = [[Harlequins Rugby League|Harlequins RL]] |year1start = 2004 |year1end = 2007 |appearances1 = 48 |tries1 = |goals1 = |fieldgoals1 = |points1 = 44 |club2 = [[Doncaster RLFC|Doncaster]] |year2start = 2008 |year2end = |appearances2 = 13 |tries2 = |goals2 = |fieldgoals2 = |points2 = 14 |updated = |source = |new = yes }} '''Zebastian Lucky Luisi''' (born 22 December 1984 in [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]) is a [[New Zealand]] [[rugby league]] player who currently plays for the [[Otahuhu Leopards]] in the [[Auckland Rugby League]] competition. ==Early years== [[Image:Shaun ainscough try for wigan vs barrow (05-04-09).JPG|thumb|200px|left|Luisi attempting to tackle [[Wigan Warriors]] [[Shaun Ainscough]] whilst playing for [[Barrow Raiders|Barrow]]]] Luisi is a [[New Zealand national rugby league team|Junior Kiwi]] international. Luisi previously played for the [[Eastern Tornadoes]] in the [[Bartercard Cup]], the top level rugby league competition in [[New Zealand]]. ==England== Zebastian Lucky Luisi joined London on a 2-year contract at the end of 2004's [[Super League IX]] after putting together some impressive performances on trial with the club during that season. The big full-back was selected to play for the [[Harlequin F.C.|Harlequins]] rugby union side for the [[Middlesex Sevens]] at [[Twickenham Stadium]]. <ref name="Amesbury to captain Quins Sevens squad">{{Cite web|url=http://www.quins.co.uk/newspage.ink?nid=37715&newstype=p&matchid=&Refid=&storytype=RU|title=Amesbury to captain Quins Sevens squad|publisher=Quins|date=2007-08-19|accessdate=2007-08-19}}</ref> Lucky Luisi played for [[Doncaster RLFC|Doncaster]] in [[National League Two]] having signed in February 2008 from [[Harlequins Rugby League|Harlequins RL]]. At the start of the 2009 Season he joined championship club Barrow Raiders Luisi's position of choice is as a [[Rugby league positions#Fullback|full-back]]. He can also operate on the [[Rugby league positions#Wing|wing]] and in the [[Rugby league positions#Centre|centres]] where he is to feature for Doncaster. He returned home in 2012, joining the [[Otahuhu Leopards]] in the [[Auckland Rugby League]] competition.<ref name=14april>[http://www.aucklandleague.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/Team-List-Template2.pdf Team Lists 14 April 2012] ''aucklandleague.co.nz''</ref> In 2013 he is the player-coach of the [[Howick Hornets]].<ref name=teamlists>[http://www.aucklandleague.co.nz/premiership/team-lists/ Team Lists] ''aucklandleague.co.nz'', 30 March 2013</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.barrowrlfc.com/barrow_rugby_teamdetails.asp?playerID=71 Barrow Raiders profile] * [http://www.quins.co.uk/playerdisplayRL.ink?skip=7&season=2006/2007&playertype=s Harlequins RL Profile] {{Barrow Raiders Rugby League squad}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Luisi, Zebastian Lucky | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Rugby league player | DATE OF BIRTH =22 December 1984 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Auckland]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Luisi, Zebastian Lucky}} [[Category:New Zealand rugby league players|Lucky Luisi, Zebastian]] [[Category:Harlequins Rugby League players|Lucky Luisi, Zebastian]] [[Category:London Broncos players]] [[Category:Doncaster RLFC players]] [[Category:Barrow Raiders players]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:New Zealand people of Niuean descent]] [[Category:Eastern Tornadoes players]] [[Category:Otahuhu Leopards players]] [[Category:Howick Hornets players]] [[Category:Howick Hornets coaches]] [[Category:New Zealand rugby league coaches]]
